name: sheet rolling, aluminium | sheet rolling, aluminium | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/5688/documentation

Aluminium ingots of 500-700 mm thickness and up to 25 tonnes weight, are rolled, first hot, then cold, to a final sheet thickness ranging from 0.2 to 6 mm. The module can be applied also for section bar rolling of aluminium.;[This dataset was already contained in the ecoinvent database version 2. It was not individually updated during the transfer to ecoinvent version 3. Life Cycle Impact Assessment results may still have changed, as they are affected by changes in the supply chain, i.e. in other datasets. This dataset was generated following the ecoinvent quality guidelines for version 2. It may have been subject to central changes described in the ecoinvent version 3 change report (http://www.ecoinvent.org/database/ecoinvent-version-3/reports-of-changes/), and the results of the central updates were reviewed extensively. The changes added e.g. consistent water flows and other information throughout the database. The documentation of this dataset can be found in the ecoinvent reports of version 2, which are still available via the ecoinvent website. The change report linked above covers all central changes that were made during the conversion process.]

The activity starts with the ingot entering the proces. The material on which this service activity is applied it is not included as input.

All the process steps, which can be attributed to semi-fabrication (sawing, scalping, hot rolling, cold rolling, solution heat treatment, finishing and packaging), are included. Does not include the material beeing rolled, only the amount of scrap lost in waste is balanced as primary aluminium input. Includes the transport of the materials to the plant, but does not include the transport of the product to the customer.
category: C:Manufacturing/24:Manufacture of basic metals/242:Manufacture of basic precious and other non-ferrous metals/2420:Manufacture of basic precious and other non-ferrous metals

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Data-set is representive for European Union
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Avarage technique for European Union. The infrastructure was assumed to be the same as for rolling steel.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Literature, estimation for transport and infrastructure

exchanges.description: Calculated based on literature, (Vionnet, S., Quantis Water Database - Technical Report, 2012). It includes the processes: hot rolling, acid pickling, cold rolling and finishing. It is assumed that water use is reported as a sum and that 100% is used as process water (material conditioning = water comes into contact with the product).
